channel.title: Florn.net Podcast
channel.description: My own little brain dump, poetry corner, coffee shop, soap box, and boom box. Listen to original poetry and essays, podsafe music, interviews, and rants about this and that. Remember, it's the coffee talking. Hosted by Dan Adinolfi.
channel.itunes:author: Dan Adinolfi
channel.itunes:subtitle: My own little brain dump, poetry corner, coffee shop, soap box, and boom box.
channel.itunes:summary: The Florn.net Podcast is my own little brain dump, poetry corner, coffee shop, soap box, and boom box. Caffeine is worshipped, snark is encouraged, and BS is not tolerated. Listen to original poetry and essays, podsafe music, interviews, and rants about this and that. Remember, it's the coffee talking. Produced in Ithaca, NY.
channel.itunes:keywords: music, coffee, ithaca, rant, essay, interview, geek, story, writing, poetry

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 04 July 2006 - A Few Odds and Ends
item.description:
Though Spring is long gone, it's time for some Spring Cleaning at the Florn.net Podcast. Sorting through the box of accumulated stuff that was intended for the podcast, I've put together a show of original poetry and music. But this isn't junk, so sit back and enjoy while watching me do all the dirty work.


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 20 June 2006 - A Quick Drink
item.description:
Belly up to the bar and enjoy a quick drink or two. On tap, I have two songs from the Podsafe Music Network and an original poem called "Kiss of the Glass". You may never look at stout the same way again.


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 12 June 2006 - On the Road
item.description:
Video from the road! During a road trip, I got bored in the car and decided to test out the iSight camera in my new MacBook Pro. Today's video podcast is a quick rant about American cars and how they reflect the dominant American culture. Vroom!


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.
item.itunes:keywords: video, rant, road trip, car, America

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 15 April 2006 - Security Architectures at Cornell
item.description:
Special video edition! Two weeks ago I did a presentation for the Advanced Technologies and Architectures group of Cornell Information Technologies. My presentation was entitled "Security Architectures at Cornell". Anyone interested in understanding how best to create a security architecture to protect their resources, which should include anyone who has a computer, will find this presentation interesting, informative, and (possibly) entertaining, though some of the content is geared toward tech-folk. It wasn't designed to be a layman's presentation. Still, the methodologies and philosophies should be useful for anyone.


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 15 March 2006 - First Birthday Celebration
item.description:
Happy First Birthday to the Florn.net Podcast! Today we celebrate with podsafe music from Hollow Horse, Murder the Stout, and Anemo. Also, we meet Flynn Bazzini and are gifted with his story about scary old ladies and unfortunate pigeons. Who wants some cake?


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 01 March 2006 - Where Have I Been?
item.description:
Where the hell have I been? Podsafe music from the Brobdingnagian Bards (and others) and a sonnet from The Bard help me explain it all.


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 01 February 2006 - The Poetry of Robert Burns
item.description:
Today I explore some of the poetry of Scotland's national poet, Robert Burns. From Auld Lang Syne to putting down Polemics, Burns' poetry has been a huge influence on generations of scholars, politicians, and everyday folk. Raise a cup of kindness (scotch) and join in the celebration (a week late).


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 25 January 2006 - The Blues My Baby Gives Me
item.description:
We're talking the Blues today but not with the music you might expect. Along with some tunes, I share some feedback from my Mother and an original spoken word piece called "Baby Blues". Respect the kazoo.


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 16 January 2006 - Lowest Common Denominator
item.description:
What is the value of the lowest common denominator? Today, Marie and Dan contemplate this question while enjoying some not-so-common podsafe music. Also, we share an original story called "When You Gotta Go, You Gotta Go." Down with Hootie, up with dick and fart jokes!


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 07 January 2006 - Haiku Achoo
item.description:
Podcasting when ill is dangerous! Find out how dangerous on today's show. I recite some original haiku, play a promo, and spin some great music all while under the influence of a head cold. Pass the tissues.


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 30 December 2005 - Something International
item.description:
Music from Israel and France and original spoken word about travel called "Flying Home". Today, grab a cup of coffee (probably from South America, Africa, or Southeast Asia) and take a quick spin around the world with us.


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 21 December 2005 - Twas the Podcast Before Christmas
item.description:
Merry Christmas from the Florn.net Podcast! Today, I play lots of podsafe Christmas music, recite "Twas the Night Before Christmas", and wax philosophical about rum balls, gift-giving, and other joys of the holiday season. Remember to leave Santa some coffee with his cookies!


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 16 December 2005 - Ithaca Music Showcase: Pamela Goddard
item.description:
Today, it's all about other people's art. I feature the music of Ithaca-area musician Pamela Goddard and play promos for some other podcasts worth a listening-to. Traditional music and a new-fangled method for communication: perfect together.


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 11 December 2005 - Thoughts Over a Cup of Coffee and a Glass of Gin
item.description:
Come with me to a gin joint, a coffee shop, and back again. Today, I feature some podsafe music and an original spoken word piece called "No Talking, No Drinking". Pass the olives and the creamer.


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.
item.itunes:keywords: music, poetry, coffee, drinking, talking, relationships

item.title: Florn.net Podcast 2005 Holiday Greeting
item.description:
Holiday wishes from Dan at the Florn.net Podcast.


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 30 November 2005 - Conversation Trip
item.description:
Today, my lovely wife, Marie, joins me to help break in my new microphone with conversation about pickup lines, weird job experiences, and Smurfs. A little ambient podsafe music is mixed in to set the mood. Sit back and take a trip with us.


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 26 November 2005 - Winter Driving and You
item.description:
Today, I extoll the virtues of manual transmission and good snow tires, curse lake effect snow, and admit my own lameness while telling the story of how I learned to drive standard. Vroom, baby!


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 10 November 2005 - Civic Duty
item.description:
Today, I give a quick civics lesson, talking about blood and voting. (Blood is compulsory.) Also, some podsafe music and an original poem about pulling a lever.


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.
item.itunes:keywords: music, poetry, civic duty, voting, blood

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 02 November 2005 - The Music of Harvey Keene
item.description:
Today, I play some tracks from the album "Casual Heroes" by Harvey Keene and revel in sweet guitar licks and thoughful lyrics (about pork). Also, I share some Edgar Allan Poe poetry and discuss my love for Tulsa in music.


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 24 October 2005 - Show 50 Celebration
item.description:
It's Show 50! To help celebrate this milestone, I feature music from the Podsafe Music Network, congratulations from listeners, and my lovely wife joining me in the Bungalow Studios. Discussions range from the joy of true love, theories on luck, and warnings about pressed ham. Join in the party.


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 11 October 2005 - Fall and Broken
item.description:
Today, I swear a lot. More importantly, I feature the music of i am jen, rant about pop culture bad-mouthing the geek, and read some very broken poetry.


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 05 October 2005 - On Geeking and Fandom
item.description:
Today, I expose my geek to you, the listener. I chat about Star Trek fandom, the annual Watkins Glen Walk, and spin some podsafe music for flavor. Live long and prosper.


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.
item.itunes:keywords: music, ithaca, starfleet, fandom, geek, trek

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 22 September 2005 - Ithaca Music Showcase: Benjamin Costello
item.description:
Today I feature an interview with and the music of Benjamin Costello, a great Ithaca-area singer and songwriter. Benjamin and I chat about his music, and Benjamin plays two of his original songs, "Walk Away" and "Fall".


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 16 September 2005 - Party On
item.description:
We had a party at the Bungalo Studios, and it's been a wacky evening. To help close it up, I invite my friend Deanna on the mic to share a poem by Amy Lowell and play some music from the Podsafe Music Network. Beware the bodily fluids.


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 13 September 2005 - The Music of the Mississippi Gulf Coast
item.description:
The Gulf Coast of Mississippi is home to a number of great musicians. Today, I feature a handful of those artists to keep the music of Mississippi playing loud and clear despite Katrina.


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 03 September 2005 - The Music of New Orleans
item.description:
The spirit of New Orleans lives on in her music as much as in the hearts of the people of the Crescent City. Join me for a sample of the music created by New Orleans artists. Also, I toss out a quick rant about our federal government's reaction to Hurricane Katrina.


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 29 August 2005 - Anger and Catharsis
item.description:
Anger is a dangerous thing. In the last two weeks, I have had cause to be angry. Very angry. Listen to me work my way through this anger with loud music and calm discussion.


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 17 August 2005 - The Innocence Project, Part Two
item.description:
This show features the second part of a two-part interview with Jeff Anbinder. Jeff, along with being a friend of mine, is a recent law school graduate. While attending law school, he worked for The Innocence Project. Today, Jeff gets into the details of one of the cases that he worked on for the Project involving Thomas Doswell, a man falsely accused of rape who, through the Innocence Project, was able to find his way back to freedom.


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 14 August 2005 - The Innocence Project, Part One
item.description:
This show features the first part of a two-part interview with Jeff Anbinder. Jeff, along with being a friend of mine, is a recent law school graduate. While attending law school, he worked for The Innocence Project. Listen as Jeff describes life after law school and the work The Innocence Project does to help exonerate the wrongly accused.


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 11 August 2005 - Pennsic War Is Even Better Than The Real Thing
item.description:
Once again, thousands of folks in garb head to Western PA to play at the giant Pennsic War! We celebrate Show 40 with thoughts about Pennsic from Marie and I and listen to some music that reminds us of the War.


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 04 August 2005 - Astronut
item.description:
Thoughts of high orbit and the mysteries of the universe creep in and take me away on today's show. Joining me on the trip is some music by the Flying Heroes of the UK and Deliens out of Belgium. Also, some Dr. Seuss-inspired poetry!


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 31 July 2005 - I-Town Showcase: Trevor MacDonald
item.description:
Today, I feature an interview with and the music of Trevor MacDonald. Trevor shares with us his thoughts about music, life, and the Ithaca creative scene.


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 26 July 2005 - I-Town Showcase: Paso Fino
item.description:
Today, I feature the music of Ithaca-area band Paso Fino. Also, I share an interview I recorded with Paso Fino's lead singer, Diana Anderson.


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 21 July 2005 - Pimp My Friends
item.description:
Today, I take a soundseeing tour of Pixel, a local lounge in Ithaca. I also interview Jim Frenette, one of Pixel's lords and masters. At the end, I have a exciting (damn) announcement concerning the musical future of my show. w00t!


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 19 July 2005 - Board To Death Do Us Part
item.description:
Nice rack! I got a new mixing board. Mm... geekgasm. Also, a banjo tune, techno tune, and poem by D.H. Lawrence to sum up some thoughts about weddings and marriage.


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.
item.itunes:keywords: wedding, mixer, poem, techno, banjo, foraminiferae

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 14 July 2005 - Tanked!
item.description:
Inspired by television once again, I talk about pet fish and their world. Also, some music from Italy, Florida, and Portland, and an original poem. Don't get the ick!


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 10 July 2005 - Come Fly With Me
item.description:
Inspired by watching the movie Airplane!, I tell some tales of the silly horrors I have witnessed in the air. Also, some music by the Syracuse band 3rd and Main and an original poem, "Con Trail". Don't call me "Shirley".


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 05 July 2005 - The Sky is Jealous
item.description:
Happy July 4th a day late. Today I groove to some jazz and talk about this and that. Also, I feature an original work called "The Sky is Jealous", inspired by my July 4th weekend.


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 30 June 2005 - Parental Fear of the Gross, and Other Stories
item.description:
Today we explore the joy and pain of all the gross stuff parents get to experience while raising a small child. We have some music from The Barnyard Playboys and an original essay.


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 26 June 2005 - Oi, Canada
item.description:
It's Show #30! Tonight, my lovely wife, Marie, joins me in the Bungalow Studios for a celebration of Canada... and a celebration of Show #30! Lots of music by Canadian musicians and our thoughts about America's Neighbor to the North.


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 18 June 2005
item.description:
Happy Fathers Day from the Florn.net Podcast! Today, we consider fatherhood with some original poetry, play a tune by Joe White of Nashville, and live in fear of felines.


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 14 June 2005
item.description:
To make up for the lack of music in the last show, I offer you two songs by Anne Davis of Nashville. Also, see if you can keep up with my stream of conciousness. Everyone loves a challenge.


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 09 June 2005
item.description:
Today's show is brought to you by the letter B! I talk about bugs and blood and read an original short story about beards. Also, discover the hidden agenda of the porcupine.


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 04 June 2005
item.description:
A treat for us today, we have a the music of Alan Rose, recorded live at Ithaca Festival on June 3, 2005. Listen and enjoy!


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 01 June 2005
item.description:
Still no sign of the porcupine. Instead, we have a special guest, Alex Schwartz, reading his poetry and the music of Ithacan Sean Kobuk. Happy Birthday, Scotch!


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 29 May 2005
item.description:
Today I am sick. Very ill. Learn about my hallucinations and how one can use a butt as as medical device.


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 25 May 2005
item.description:
Why did I say "porcupine"? Today, for your aural pleasure, I have some traditional Celtic music courtesy of Mike Gray and a track by the Ithaca band The Coopertones. Also, I recite some nanofiction and another original short story.


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 21 May 2005
item.description:
Today we have some music: "If I Ever Make It Home", by Tyler Jakes, and "Fall", by Benjamin Costello. Also, some poetry written in a coffeeshop haze and thoughts about the audience. Beware the dustbunny.


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 15 May 2005
item.description:
Today's podcast, done after a few Guinnesses (yay, number 21!), features the music of Tyler Jakes, the poetry of Alex Schwartz and your host, and the effects of post traumatic stress disorder.


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 11 May 2005
item.description:
It's Show #20! This extra-log edition of the Florn.net Podcast includes some tunes, a poem, and Dan and Marie being cute. We contemplate deep philosophy and brilliant bitterness as well.


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 08 May 2005
item.description:
It's a celebration of Mother's Day and Haiku Day! Also, some music by Seattle's Scott Andrew and a review of Xinlisupreme's "Zouave's Blue".


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 05 May 2005
item.description:
Today's show includes some more music by Enter the Haggis, some poetry by Dave Graham, and an original essay entitled "Paco and His Flan".


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 03 May 2005
item.description:
Music Week is over, but music talk continues, including a track by Enter the Haggis. Also, a poem by Mazzie and a rant about yield signs.


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 30 April 2005
item.description:
We finish Music Week with a studio guest, JC Cohen. JC and Dan chat about music, contemplate the banjo, and try to scare everyone.


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 28 April 2005
item.description:
Music Week continues at the Florn.net Podcast with a studio visit by Neidfyre, Mel Ginsberg-Stevens and some musical words from Wordsworth and Yeats.


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 26 April 2005
item.description:
Music Week continues at the Florn.net Podcast with Alan Rose and The Bard.


Show notes can be found at the Florn.net Podcast website.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 24 April 2005
item.description:
It's Music Week at the Florn.net Podcast. Today we feature a fiddle tune by Mike Gray (playing the banjo instead) and a piece for Mandolin and Two-Year-Old.
Play, sing, listen, and enjoy.


http://florn.net/podcasts/

item.title: Florn.net Podcast for 20 April 2005
item.description:
It's an early Father's Day at the Bungalow Studios, and the coolest Father's Day gift is received with glee! Also, a poem about air travel entitled "Cargo".


Show notes can be found here.

item.title: Florn.net Podcast Promo
item.description:
Promo for The Florn.net Podcast. Remember, it's the coffee talking.


http://florn.net/podcasts/
